My trash is called Bin for some unknown reason. Any Takers? Please.

title: Cannot migrate profile folder
content:
Hi to all,

I try to migrate TB from an old laptop to a new laptop, but I get an error copying the source profile folder to an external hard drive. The error I get when copying with windows explorer is: 0x80070052 The directory or file cannot be created. The error occurs for roughly 30% of the files.

I also tried Robocopy and FastCopy but with the same result: still 30% of the files do not copy.

The TB version is 102.9.1 on windows 10. The profile folder is 14.8 GB large (so the export tool is not an option). The external hard-disk is formatted as FAT32. The problem occurs with files in the Inbox.mozmsgs sub folder.

Any help is much appreciated.

title: Impossibile inviare mail con account tim o alice
content: Gentilissimi, Da circa due giorni mi sono accorto che non riesco ad inviare mail con account alice e tim. Ho provato con due PC (Win 10 e Win 11) thunderbird 102.9.1 (64 bit). Il messaggio che appare è "Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Si è verificato un errore durante l’invio della posta. Il server di posta ha risposto: Message refused. Controllare il messaggio e riprovare." Tramite web i due account funzionano regolarmente. Ho provato anche ad installare una vecchia versione di Thunderbird. Gli account sono configurati in automatico dal programma. Ho provato sia Pop sia Imap. Grazie a tutti, ciao ciao.
creator: snake.xenzia.09

title: Thunderbird mail folders break permanently if trying to write to them when disk is full
content:
I have had this happen multiple times with multiple mail accounts and I've finally managed to narrow down why it happens.

The error: every time I restart Thunderbird, the affected mail accounts reset to the last proper state, which was sometimes weeks ago, requiring Thunderbird to fetch all "new" changes from the server.

If the Thunderbird appdata folder's disk is fully while the program tries to write new data to them, they irrevocably break. The only solution is deleting the account and then entering the login info again, fetching all the messages. I've tried every other possible suggested solution I could find to no avail.


102.9.1 (64-bit), Windows version

Also submitting a simple Thunderbird bug report is an absolute nightmare, for 25 minutes I've been redirected from site to site requiring me to register, then getting redirected again.
creator: Forager

title: thunderbird non invia la posta di Alice Mail
content:
ciao a tutti. improvvisamente thunderbird ha smesso di inviare la mail dai miei account Alice Mail, che hanno sempre funzionato benissimo. Non invia ma riceve tutto normalmente. mi dice: Invio del messaggio non riuscito. Si è verificato un errore durante l'invio della posta.Il Server ha risposto: Message refused. Controllare il messaggio e riprovare.

La porta è quella corretta, 587 mi sembra. il bello è che da cellulare, con bluemail, invia tutto normalmente. Dal server invia tutto. Da Thunderbird no. Sempre in thunderbird ho impostato anche le email di gmail ed un altra e funziona tutto. solo con Alice non va più in uscita.

Ho windows10, Avast e Windows Defender. Thunderbird è aggiornato all'ultima versione. aiutatemi per favore. grazie.

title: Occasional fail on "reply"
content:
I host my site/email with Site5.com I've used TB for years without issue. I'm on Win10, TB version 102.9.1 (64-bit) About two months ago, I noticed that "random" reply emails (Never on a new email) fail. --- I've uninstalled TB and re-installed Tried both pop3 and IMAP Changed ports, etc at the suggestion of Site5 support

==

Not all email replies fail from this account. I have several other domain emails with site5 that have no issue. I've masked the real emails below for obvious reasons.

This is an example fail reply: This message was created automatically by mail delivery software.

A message that you sent could not be delivered to one or more of its recipients. This is a permanent error. The following address(es) failed: 

 ReplyFailed@xxxxx.com    host eig-west.smtp.a.cloudfilter.net [34.223.136.48]    SMTP error from remote mail server after end of data:    550 jieqpvbkBZdoJjieqpHF65 - <EmailAddress@thewebinarguy.com> message rejected AUP#SNDR


Reporting-MTA: dns; reseller48.webserversystems.com

Action: failed Final-Recipient: rfc822;ReplyFailed@xxxxx.com Status: 5.0.0 Remote-MTA: dns; eig-west.smtp.a.cloudfilter.net Diagnostic-Code: smtp; 550 jieqpvbkBZdoJjieqpHF65 - <EmailAddress@thewebinarguy.com> message rejected AUP#SNDR

title: sent items doubled with outlook account
content:
Hi, I have several outlook account, one of them (the only one) when I send an email, places the message twice in "sent items". This are my settings:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-04-04-08-47-44-c4ca42.png

As you can see "Place a copy in" is not selected. This should be enough to have just one copy of the email in "sent items" (becase of IMAP). However if I tick and untick that option I have this:

https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-04-04-08-49-45-c81e72.png

Now combobox are greyed. However this setting is not maintained if I close settings window.

Account is IMAP, Thunderbird version is 102.9.1 on Windows 10. E-mail is actually sent just once, it's only in the "sent items" that appears twice (also in outlook webmail).

Any help?
creator: rokopi

title: Shared Calendar - Color Coordinate Events
content:
I have created a shared calendar to use within our company. It is used to schedule our crews as they go to the field and is created and shared via WebDAV link.

I am looking for a way to color coordinate different events, which will help identify which crew they have been assigned to. I have tried using the Categories to mark the events, which is a temporary solution. But I would prefer if the entire event changed color, not just a small rectangle on the side. The other issue is that Categories are specific to my email account, so I can see the Categories on an event, but my colleagues cannot.

I am looking for a solution to this issue. The two possibilities I see are either to be able to have a shared Categories list, or be able to color coordinate the event itself.

If anyone has found a solution or has had a similar issue, I am all ears! Thank you.
creator: rachael.orsi

title: Reply-To missing from filter message headers
content:
The most effective anti-spam method is the message filter "Isn't in my address book". It's amazing how no other email client (and I've been looking, for the ios) has this simple functionality. Yet another great thing about T-boid. However, it is easy to get spam though this filter since spoofing the FROM header to be the sender's own address is trivial. If only one could do the same for the "Reply-To" field; but alas, it is not to be. Even if a custom header is created, the option "Isn't in my address book" is not available.

Can we please add this in?
creator: Rahzan

title: Thunderbird not allowing access to smtp
content: I have been using thunderbird for the last couple of years since incredimail closed down. But in the last couple of days i switched my broadband supplier, i can still receive emails but can no longer send any. My new supplier is imagine, i set the smtp to smtp.imagine.ie and also tried mail.imagine.ie but neither will work. I spoke to imagine technical support on the phone and they got me to do a ping test with their server and it connected. They then informed me that the fault lies with my email client.
